page.title: 08Newton and Biggin Villages
page.content: Newton and Biggin were mentioned in the Domesday Book:Newton had 6 villagers,4 smallholders and meadows of 2.5 acres;total value 32s,Biggin ( or Holme)had 2 villagers,2 smallholders,1 slave and 6 acres;value 13s.Biggin no longer exists but excavations in the 1950's revealed remains of a dwelling surrounded by a moat or water course.These depressions can still be seen today.In later years the G.C.R. built a line from Rugby going north of Newton while the L.M.S.R.'s line went via the south side.Both were abandoned and land is now owned by the council for leisure walks,picnic area and car park.The original St. Thomas's Cross was sited opposite the present pub.Stones said to be from it are to found at Manor Farm and behind the Post Office.
